name: Nelson House B & B

reviews.text: Lovely old house. Very clean and comfortable. Excellent breakfast. Helpful friendly staff. Great central location. We stayed in a room with bath down the hall. This was not a problem, bathroom was always available. They have rooms with their own bath also available. Free WiFi was a bonus.
reviews.title: Really nice place and people

reviews.text: We stayed at Nelson House twice in August and September 2007. Great location close to Robson, Denman and Davie Streets and a pleasant walk to Downtown. Good breakfasts. Helpful advice. Laidback atmosphere. If, like us, you are older straights, don't worry about the 'gay friendly' tag. It makes for really interesting guests and breakfast conversations. They almost have to throw the guests out the door at 10.30am to get on with the cleaning. Staying here added to the Vancouver experience. Check it out!
reviews.title: Terrific value!

reviews.text: This is the second time in three years that I have had the EXTREME pleasure of staying at the Nelson House B&B. This year I brought two additional friends along, to experience the wonderful hospitality. Located in the West End, it is close to Davie Street, the Vancouver International Film Festival, main bus lines and easy walking distance to many great sites of the city. David and his staff run a tight ship - wonderful breakfasts, clean rooms, engaging conversation and wonderful suggestions for sightseeing.
reviews.title: Nelson House B&B - The BEST

reviews.text: Would I go next week if I could? Without blinking an eye, YES! It should be on the list best places to stay in Vancouver.
reviews.title: Very nice B&B in the heart of the West End

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in September, this was our last stop in Canada before returning home. The accommodation was very clean and tidy and the breakfasts were very enjoyable, they were certainly not something that could be rushed. With the morning conversations round the dining table breakfast lasted well over an hour. The property was located in a safe area and very close to the Bay and Stanley Park. Of all the accommodation that we stayed in that was situated in large towns this was the only place where we did not use public transport, we were able to walk to all of the places that were of interest to us.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay

reviews.text: Matthew was a good host and very willing to point out places of interest and local restaurants.
reviews.title: Laid back, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would certainly stay here again if we were in Vancover.
reviews.title: A perfect place to stay

likes.liked: — The rooms - so spacious and immaculately clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Shangri-La Suite. Lovely home in a great location. Attracts an interesting and intelligent crowd. Relaxed and laid-back atmosphere. Breakfast was fun, ample and tasty. I saw one of the communal bathrooms and it was spotless.
reviews.title: A Home from Home

reviews.text: I wrote afterwards that there was an odor in the room upon entry (musty) and on my clothes later in the week after leaving. I did not mention it at the time because I did acclimate to the odor during the stay and left the windows open. The owner assured me that it was a dresser drawer set and has been rectified since my visit. Just a heads up of warning but if this has been fixed I can't imagine why you would need to stay anywhere else. I would try it again.
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You really can't go wrong in choosing to stay at this splendid little B&B. It has plenty of character and is in the most wonderful location; quiet yet in the heart of the city, close to everything. No need for taxis to restaurants, there is all you need at your doorstep. The service really was very good and Matthew has plenty of advice to offer. The ambiance of the breakfast table was what we most enjoyed, guests sharing their experiences and plenty of laughter. The cooked breakfast was pretty good too. Our room (the Hollywood)was large, quiet and very comfortable.We were pleased that we stayed at the Nelson and would not hesitate to recommend it.
reviews.title: An excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at this place, we were supposed to find a little basket with a key somewhere. I couldn't find it, so I rang the bell. A certain Briana answered the door, asking if I had rung the bell. I said I hoped she hadn't been waiting for us until we arrived. No, she, said, I live here. She added breakfast was from nine till half past ten, handed me our key and off she went. We haven't seen her since.
reviews.title: weird place

reviews.text: The room was ok, but the bed a bit worn. Breakfast was served by a certain Michael, who never told us when exactly we could have breakfast, like they do in all the b & b's we have had the privilege to stay in until now. The result was that the breakfast table was full with people, we just had to wait in the lounge, not knowing when it was our turn. At the table, a bunch of Swiss people were explaining how wonderful their country is to two American brothers, they were all having a great time, but nobody cared about us.
reviews.title: "Its one of the best B&B's I've ever stayed in"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to ask this Matthew or Michael ourselves how and when we were supposed to pay for our stay; when we left in the end, nobody was to be seen, we didn't even know where to leave the key.
reviews.title: A gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You could call all this laidback, I call it a lack of communication. We have been staying in Canada for five weeks. This was the most expensive place of all. It was the only negative experience we've had in Canada.
reviews.title: Great Location with clean comfortable atmosphere!

description: Character, comfort and convenience in Vancouver's downtown, West End. A three-story, century old home operating as a bed and breakfast since 1990.
